variants.Description in input context: This A>G substitution in exon 16 causes a frameshift and premature stop codon.
This C>T substitution in exon 15 causes altered splicing.

Material used.Description: Fibroblasts were obtained from patients diagnosed with sporadic ALS.

Readout description.Result Description: The mRNA levels for the FUS variant NM_001205278:c.1844A>G were reduced by approximately 60% compared to healthy controls.
Splicing analysis revealed the inclusion of a novel intronic sequence due to the NM_001205278:c.2325C>T variant, leading to reduced levels of the full-length FUS protein.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were performed on fibroblasts from three independent patients with ALS.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was processed and analyzed in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Fibroblasts from healthy donors were used as controls.

Basic negative control.Description: No specific negative control was used in this RT-qPCR assay.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test was used to compare expression levels.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: mRNA expression within 2 standard deviations of the mean for healthy controls.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: mRNA expression greater than 2 standard deviations from the mean for healthy controls.
